newsitem.title: USA: Airport Systems posts sharp Q2 sales gain.
newsitem.headline: Airport Systems posts sharp Q2 sales gain.

text.p: Airport Systems International Inc said a surge in new orders helped the company post a 48 percent gain in sales in the second quarter to $4 million.

Net income in the period reached $62,000, compared to a loss of $368,000 in the corresponding period one year ago, Airport Systems said. Sales in the second quarter of fiscal 1995 reached $2.6 million.

"This performance relates directly to our success in booking more than $20 million in new orders over the past 12 months," said Keith Cowan, the company's president and chief executive officer. "The positive momentum in incoming business continued in the second quarter with new navaid contracts exceeding $5 million."
Airport Systems International designs and markets ground-based equipment, called navaids, and airfield signs that ease in-flight navigation and ground movement of aircraft at the nation's airports.
